subject: Re: [junit] Can anyone help me see how to usefully work with JUnit in a big project, please?
msgSnippet: ... I /have/ read the Singh book, and rather enjoyed it. As for writing it down, I have this stack of cards over here, /and/ I have this:
messageBody:
Joakim Ohlrogge wrote:
>
>
> > I have a proof, but the margin is too small to contain it.
> I didn't read Simon Singhs book but from what I heard from people
> reading it you better write it down right now or you will keep future
> scientists real busy for quite some time :)

I /have/ read the Singh book, and rather enjoyed it. As for writing it
down, I have this stack of cards over here, /and/ I have this:

http://tinyurl.com/y2aexl

It begins.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
